subject: Cooking
title: Empanadas: A Continent in a Pocket
description: One-minute skill: Empanadas: A Continent in a Pocket.

hook.text: Argentina's empanadas are different from Colombia's, which are different from Chile's. Same shape. Different worlds.

buildup.text: Empanadas trace to medieval Spain's empanada gallega â€” a large stuffed bread meant for portable eating.

discovery.text: Spanish colonizers brought the concept. Each Latin American country adapted it with local fillings and dough.

twist.text: Argentine empanadas are baked; Colombian empanadas are fried. The dough, fillings, and folds differ by region.

climax.text: Empanada festivals attract thousands across Latin America â€” the humble pocket pie is a symbol of national identity.

punchline.text: Every country made the empanada its own. That's how culture fills a pocket.

quiz.question: Where did empanadas originally come from?
